name: Americas Best Value Inn Gilroy

reviews.text: Me and my family had 3 Rooms and this place for two weeks when we sold our home the staff was so friendly and the facility was beautiful and safe for my entire family , thank you too all , we will highly recommend your establishment
reviews.title: Americas Best in Gilroy , CA the friendlyest and cleanest Hotel in Town
Extremely Disappointed
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night recently after reading the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor and being attracted by the great price. The price is very good, one of the cheapest hotels I have stayed at in a long time. Also the bed was comfortable enough, so no problem there, and the refrigerator worked well. And I was a little concerned about traffic noise but that was no problem. However it is not up to the standards of the recent reviews I read here making it the number one hotel in Gilroy. Yes, the front desk was very accomodating, no complaints there. But the room was very substandard. The carpet was dirty, the furniture was worn, the chairs at the desks were all stained. Also the mirror over the sink was broken at the corner and the wallpaper adjoining it was peeling. So maybe we got the worst room in the place? Finally many reviews rave about the breakfast. It was the worst breakfast I have seen at a hotel. It is supposed to be from 6 to 9 am. We got there at 8:30 and there was virtually nothing there. Again, great price but very disappointing nonetheless.

We had a lovely stay in this hotel. The room was very clean and we had everything we needed. Breakfast was good and all facilities were clean and bright. This has been our best night so far in California. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Great service and friendly staff. Checking in and getting a room was without hassle and quick, from office to room in about 10 minutes, without reservations! Rooms are decent, not the 5 star hotel you are hoping for but it's a great place to be at when you have just done a long drive. Very close to premium outlets and therefore a great location. Very affordable place as well with a waffle machine that you can use while having your breakfast which is a good meal to have before you set off for the road again. great computer in in the office for your use too, it's a windows 8, newest thing here I suppose, even I can't handle the controls, but it is a smooth smooth computer for you to do your emails and bookings and what not.
reviews.title: Great Stop for your LONG drive from LA to San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding at one of the local wineries. The rooms look a little run down and there were a couple flies in the room, but it was otherwise clean and quiet. If you just need a basic room for a night or two you really can't beat the price.
reviews.title: Can't beat the price

reviews.text: We showed up and had to wait for someone to come to the desk. There was drunk people on the upstairs balcony at 4 in the afternoon. The wi-fi is worthless. The non-smoking room smells like a wet ashtray with the nutty and fruity overtones of urine. Spend the extra $20 and stay away.
reviews.title: Drunken party at 4 in the afternoon.

reviews.text: I booked a room for one night at this hotel & was very happy. Unexpectedly had to return in the middle of the day for another night. Dilip & the cleaning staff were very accomdating & cleaned my old room & put me right back in it even though it was not yey check in time. rooms are clean & quiet & beds are comfortable. I travel the entire country & will always stay here when I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Service above & beyond the norm.

reviews.text: Thought I would just get the cheapest, but you get what you pay for in this case. Must be family owned....like it's a hassle for the person to come to the front desk. We went back and forth with the front desk woman about having a smoking vs non-smoking room listed in the reservation - why, we were the only people there. She gave us the room and it smelled horrible. Maybe it was a smoking room before....who knows, but it was bad. We opened the window and that helped a bit, but you can only stand so much of hearing people's car idle and listening to them order food at the Burger King drive through....yes, she gives us the room closest when the whole place is empty. We stayed regardless, but if I had to do it again, I would have left. The room just seemed crappy even with the mircrowave and refrigerator. This place needs a complete make-over (done right) including double-pane windows. I say spend the extra money and go elsewhere!
reviews.title: Don't stay here....spend the extra bucks

reviews.text: I stayed at the ABVI in Gilroy on the way back from Los Angeles, on my way to the SFO airport. Gilroy is a lovely little town, with all kinds of shops just down the road! The owners of the motel are really nice, and the rooms were clean and tidy! For the price, I think this place is a bargain, and really recommend it :-)
reviews.title: Really nice stay!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while on a trip up north for job interviews. I was on a budget, so the price was right. It's location is within walking distance of a great restaurant, The Black Bear Diner, which has huge portions and you will always leave stuffed. It is also extremely close to an In-N-Out Burger, Burger King, a ton of outlet stores, and Highway 101. The carpet in the room was a little dirty, like it needed a good shampooing, but other than that, my room was clean, and the hotel cleaning staff was very friendly. They had the best shower pressure that I have EVER experienced in a hotel, and they had those really cool, new, low-flow, energy-efficient toilets. I wasn't sure about the bed at first glance, it looked quite flimsy, but it was actually very comfortable, as were the pillows. I woke up late on my last day there and was in a rush to get out by the 11 AM checkout time. As a result, I left behind something very important. They held onto it for me and I was able to pick it up when I returned to the area a few weeks later. I am very grateful for the hotel owners for doing that for me, since they don't have to keep items left behind by customers if they don't want to.
reviews.title: Cheap Stay

reviews.text: We've been in the hotel for just one night and we were happy with it. Good to find, nice people there and a big and comfortable room. No luxury or anything, but good enough for us. Breakfast included, free wifi, microwave etc, everything we needed.
reviews.title: Good time

reviews.text: I was in Gilroy for golf in the area with friends this past weekend, and based on other reviews here I picked this property. I was very glad I did. Dilip, the proprietor, claims that their rooms are larger than any of the other hotels nearby. Not having stayed at any of them I can't verify that, but based on the size of the room I had it wouldn't surprise me one bit. The room was surprisingly large, especially for the price, furnished nicely, and with what was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in at any hotel. For someone with chronic back problems, that alone was worth the price. Even though it's right off the freeway it was surprisingly quiet at night, with not a bit of road noise getting through.
reviews.title: This is THE place to stay in Gilroy

reviews.text: Dilip and his wife are very gracious hosts who clearly take their roles seriously, and take great pride in providing excellent accommodations and service. You can't beat the price, either. I've paid a lot more for a lot less at other hotels in my travels. This one's a keeper!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

description: America's Best Value Presidents Inn on Murray Avenue is located immediately off the 101 exit for the Gilroy Premium Shopping Outlets. Our hotel is only a few minutes drive from the Shopping, Bonfante Gardens, the Gilroy Wine Trail, and Dining Locale. Originally known as the "Sunrest Inn" an oasis for truck drivers and their rigs on the long haul. The current hotel has gone through several renovations and is in alignment with industry standards for accommodations that fit the needs of the Mid Scale Consumer. We strive to provide guests with value beyond the room. These features include: complimentary WIFI service over the 2 acre grounds, A very large Pool, Lounge Deck and Hot Tub (Closed Winter), A family sized private breakfast suite serving a continental menu, A modern business center featuring a large computer screen and printer with internet access, An onsite guest laundry, and A private Conference Center that can seat 30+ classroom style, in re-development is a fitness center suite.
